question.question: What is the main difference between squamous cell carcinoma and basal cell carcinoma?
question.option_a: Both are types of skin cancer that arise from the epidermis.
question.option_b: Squamous cell carcinoma is more aggressive and has a higher risk of metastasis, while basal cell carcinoma is more common and has a lower risk of metastasis.
question.option_c: Squamous cell carcinoma is more likely to occur in sun-exposed areas, while basal cell carcinoma is more common in areas with minimal sun exposure.
question.option_d: Squamous cell carcinoma is more likely to be diagnosed at an advanced stage, while basal cell carcinoma is more likely to be diagnosed at an early stage.
